Class Engine

java.lang.Object
tage.Engine
public class Engine extends Object
The Engine object holds references to the primary game engine components, and provides accessors for them. It also maintains a link to the current game application.

The first thing that a game application should do is instantiate this engine class using the three-argument constructor. The arguments are a link back to the game application, and the desired window dimensions.

Author:
Scott Gordon

    The game application should first call this constructor, supplying a pointer back to itself.
